[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 50]
Reasoning: Looking at the current game state, I need to decide whether to play the Big Blind or skip it for the Foil Tag.

Current situation:
- Ante 3/8, Round 6
- I have the Coupon Tag (Initial cards and booster packs in next shop are free)
- Current Money: $9
- Big Blind: 3000 chips needed, $4 reward
- Skip reward: Foil Tag (Next base edition shop Joker is free and becomes Foil)
- Boss Blind: 4000 chips needed, -1 Hand Size, $5 reward

My joker lineup:
1. Zany Joker - +12 Mult for Three of a Kind
2. Sock and Buskin - Retriggers face cards
3. Wrathful Joker - +3 Mult per spade scored
4. Business Card - Money from face cards
5. Abstract Joker - +15 Mult

Recent performance:
- Four of a Kind: 7,052 chips
- Flush: 1,995 chips
- Three of a Kind: 1,890 chips
- Full House: 1,344 chips

Analysis:
1. I just skipped the Small Blind to get the Coupon Tag, which gives me free initial cards and booster packs in the next shop.
2. If I play the Big Blind now, I'll go to the shop with the Coupon Tag and be able to get free boosters/cards.
3. If I skip the Big Blind for the Foil Tag, I'll get a free foil joker in the shop, but I won't go to the shop until after the Boss Blind.

The issue with skipping again is:
- I'd face the Boss Blind (4000 chips, -1 hand size) without shopping first
- I wouldn't be able to use my Coupon Tag until after the Boss


- The Foil Tag is valuable, but not as immediately useful as being able to shop with the Coupon Tag NOW

Playing the Big Blind gives me immediate access to the shop with my Coupon Tag, letting me strengthen my deck with free boosters before the Boss Blind. My recent Three of a Kind score of 1,890 chips is close to the 3000 needed, and with proper play I should reach it. Since the Boss Blind's -1 hand size penalty is significant, I want to be as prepared as possible before facing it.

I should play the Big Blind now. chips × (3 + 9 + 12 + 15) mult = 60 × 39 = 2,340 chips. With the steel card multiplier of 1.5x, that brings me to 3,510 chips—well above the 3000 threshold needed. I'm confident this hand will succeed, so I'll proceed with playing the round.

1. King of Spades (Steel Card - +10 chips, X1.5 Mult while in hand)
2. 4 of Hearts (+4 chips)
3. 10 of Clubs (+10 chips)
4. 6 of Clubs (+6 chips)

2. Sock and Buskin - Retriggers all played face cards
3. Wrathful Joker - +3 Mult per spade card scored
4. Business Card - Money from face cards (1 in 2 chance to give $2)
5. Abstract Joker - +15 Mult constant

**Analysis of Current Hand:**
Looking at the cards:
- Pair of Kings (King of Spades, King of Diamonds)
- Pair of 4s (4 of Hearts, 4 of Diamonds)
- One 10 of Clubs
- One 6 of Clubs
- One 3 of Clubs
- One 9 of Diamonds

Best hand type I can currently make: **Two Pair** (Kings and 4s)

**Two Pair Calculation:**
- Base chips: 20


- Base mult: 2
- Scoring cards are the two Kings and two 4s, giving 48 total chips (20 base + 10 + 10 + 4 + 4)
- Wrathful Joker adds 3 Mult since King of Spades is the only spade in play
- Abstract Joker contributes 15 Mult
- Steel Card on King of Spades provides X1.5 Mult multiplier, though I need to verify if it applies when the card stays in hand versus being played

. If the King of Spades is played as part of the Two Pair, it won't remain in hand, so the Steel Card bonus wouldn't trigger. The bonus only works while the card stays in hand, so playing it disqualifies it from that bonus.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
